physdesc.extent: in 12 record cartons, two oversize boxes, one loose framed photograph, and 18 wav audio files.

did.physloc: Oral history recordings are available as MP3s in PastPerfect or as WAV files via the OH_Library folder on the LIBSERV network. bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Independence Community Bank was founded in Brooklyn, N.Y. in 1850 and was originally named The South Brooklyn Savings Institution. It was bought out by Sovereign Bank in 2006. After the buyout, the Brooklyn Historical Society, with the support of the Independence Community Foundation (now the Brooklyn Community Foundation), conducted 16 extended interviews with past and present employees of Independence Community Bank to document the end of the Bank's 155 years based in Brooklyn.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of records of the Board of Trustees of Independence Community Bank dating from 1850 and circa 1920 to 1981, including annual reports, various administrative and financial reports, photographs, and trophies awarded to the bank. Also included are oral history interviews with bank employees, conducted and recorded by the Brooklyn Historical Society after Independence Community Bank was bought out by Sovereign Bank in 2006. Recordings of these interviews may be listened to in the Othmer Library at the Brooklyn Historical Society. An index and transcriptions of these interviews may be read in the library.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Restrictions apply. Please consult library staff for more information.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: The Brooklyn Historical Society also possesses oil on canvas portaits of the eight presidents who led Independence Community Bank from 1850 to 1973 (accession numbers M2007.023.1 through M2007.023.8.). Item-level descriptions and digital versions of all eight portaits are available for searching via the image database in the Othmer Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Independence Community Bank records and oral histories, ARC.269, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.
The collection combines the accessions 2007.001 and 2008.032.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: Reproduction rights for photographs have not been established. All oral history recordings are the property of the Brooklyn Historical Society. Please consult library staff for more information.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Accession 2007.001, comprised of Board of Trustees records, was the gift of Independence Community Bank, 2007. Accession 2008.032 is comprised of oral history interviews with Independence Community Bank employees and subsequent transcriptions of the interviews, conducted and produced by the Brooklyn Historical Society from 2006 to 2007 and formally accessioned in 2008.
